src:
Foto: Air Terjun Cantik dari Lelehan Gletser
06 Nov 2019, 22:29 by Bonauli



Seljalandsfoss terletak di Pantai Selatan Islandia. Mari mengagumi lebih dekat air terjun setinggi 60 meter ini.Â  (iStock)



Seljalandsfoss adalah bagian dari Sungai Seljalandsa. Sungai ini juga menjadi aliran dari gletser Eyjafjallajokull. Jadi bisa dibilang, Seljalandsfoss adalah lelehan gletser. (iStock)



Air terjun Seljalandsfoss memiliki sebuah gua luas di balik rintikan airnya. Dari dalam gua, pemandangan yang dihasilkan sunggulah berbeda. (iStock)



Sambil main basah-basahan di kolam gua, wisatawan bisa menikmati sunset di seberang air terjun. Pemandangan ini jadi yang paling populer di Islandia. (iStock)



Tiap musimnya, air terjun ini menawarkan pemandangan yang berbeda. Saat musim panas, kamu akan dijamu dengan pemandangan bunga-bunga liar yang bermekaan di sisi air terjun. (iStock)



Sedangkan saat musim dingin, akan ada salju yang menutupi pinggiran air terjun. Tapi hati-hati saat berjalan di sekitar kolam karena sangat licin. (iStock)



Untuk bisa ke air terjun cantik ini, kamu bisa berkendara dari Reykjavik selama dua jam. Air terjun ini diakses melalui pertanian Seljaland di sepanjang Ring Road utama Islandia. (iStock)


Reykjavik - Inilah Seljalandsfoss, sebuah air terjun cantik di Islandia. Seljalandsfoss punya pemandangan yang beda dengan air terjun kebanyakan. Seperti apa?
text:
Photo: Beautiful Waterfall of Melt Glacier
Nov 6, 2019, 22:29 by Bonauli



Seljalandsfoss is located on the South Coast of Iceland. Let's admire this 60 meter waterfall more closely. (iStock)



Seljalandsfoss is part of the Seljalandsa River. This river is also the flow of the Eyjafjallajokull glacier. So you could say, Seljalandsfoss is glacial melt. (iStock)



Seljalandsfoss waterfall has a vast cave behind its watering sprinkler. From inside the cave, the view produced is really different. (iStock)



While playing wet in the cave pool, tourists can enjoy the sunset across the waterfall. This sight is the most popular in Iceland. (iStock)



Each season, this waterfall offers a different view. In summer, you will be treated to a view of wildflowers that are varied on the side of the waterfall. (iStock)



Whereas in winter, there will be snow that covers the edges of the waterfall. But be careful when walking around the pool because it is very slippery. (iStock)



To get to this beautiful waterfall, you can drive from Reykjavik for two hours. This waterfall is accessed via the Seljaland farm along Iceland's main Ring Road. (iStock)


Reykjavik - This is Seljalandsfoss, a beautiful waterfall in Iceland. Seljalandsfoss has a different view with most waterfalls. Like what?
